text:
Part of me is in agony for various reasons.  

Another part wants to be free from sorrow.  

We are all these conflicting parts.  

One part rejects sorrow while another seeks explanations.  

Another part escapes from the fact of sorrow.  

How can I understand sorrow totally like this?  

Integrated understanding allows freedom from sorrow.  

If I am torn in different directions, I see no truth.  

When there is no observer, suffering becomes you.  

You are not apart from the pain; you are the pain.  

Without labeling, you simply exist as that pain.  

If you are that pain, there is nothing to be done.  

A fundamental transformation occurs when you accept it.  

Then "I suffer" no longer exists without a center.  

Suffering has many varieties and complications.  

We carry this burden from birth to death.  

If we accept suffering as inevitable, we stop inquiring.  

Escaping suffering closes the door to understanding.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Understanding suffering requires an integrated approach that transcends division and escape, recognizing that one is not separate from their pain.
